Context:
Casa Loma Child Care Centre:
- Opened in 1974 as "The Learning Centre" (previously George Brown College's premier Lab School)
- Rebuilt and renamed in 1994
- Architects: A.J. Diamond and Schmidt
- Manager: Debbie Wilson, Email: dwilson@georgebrown.ca
- Centre Phone number: 416-415-5000, ext. 4616
- Address: 160 Kendal Avenue, Toronto ON, M5R 1M3
- Age groups accommodated: 6 weeks to 5 years
- Hours of operation: 8 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.
- Food: Catered by "Yummy Catering"
- Partnerships: Dental, Toronto Metropolitan University Nursing, Lifestyle and Fitness Management
- Model lab school for School of Early Childhood programs
- Provides training ground for college students
- Eligible for fee reduction for children under 6 years old
- Waitlist form available on website
- Follows guidelines from Toronto Children's Services in CWELCC plan
- Inclusive fees: no additional charges for extracurricular activities or transportation
- Contact information: ask.george@georgebrown.ca, 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559
- Social Media Hub available on website.

The text also mentions that Casa Loma Childcare centres in the School of Early Childhood have applied for and been approved for the CWELCC program. All lab schools will follow guidelines from Toronto Children's Services in implementing the plan. The fees are inclusive of all services, therefore there are no additional charges for extracurricular activities or transportation. Children under 6 are eligible for fee reduction. To join the waitlist, please complete the form available on the website and sign up to receive college news, application deadlines, upcoming events, tours and more. The information contained in the website is subject to change without notice.
